page.title: 09Local Mayor
page.content: Peter Barker is a local councellor and Mayor to the Borough of East Yorkshire {Q. What are the main changes you have {seen in Pocklington over the years.} A. Over the last 50 years the population has increased a lot, as has the number of houses. {Q. Is Burnby Hall of importance to {Pocklington. } A. Yes it's important to the whole of Yorkshire. Although the lakes in the gardens are man made, they're ideal for the water lilies which are reputed to be one of the best collections in Europe. {Q. What are the plans for the future {of Burnby Hall Gardens.} A. We hope to bring Primrose Wood into public use. It's about the same size as the parts of the gardens now open to the public, and we hope to open it as a nature reserve and nature walk.
